TITLE: 2008 ford fusion sel v6
ATTR: VIN: 3FAHP08178R194488#condition: fair#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 128640#paint color: silver#size: full-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: 2008 ford fusion sel v6#mpg: up to 20 city / 29 highway#horsepower: 221 hp#fuel tank capacity: 16.6 to 17.5 gal#i recently purchased a new vehicle so its time for me to say good-bye to my 2008 fusion. i am the second owner of the vehicle and owned it for 7 years. the fusion is in overall fair condition. mechanically the vehicle has been solid but there is an indication of a small oil leak near the engine; which i have not had a mechanic give a quote on the repair. i have used fully synthetic oil since owning the car and recently had an oil change. also; within the past year i had a complete transmission service and replaced all tires with highly rated continental purecontacts. i will include snow-chains with the purchase of the vehicle.#the interior is in good condition. 6-disk cd changer --sometimes gets jammed; bluetooth compatible --i havent been able to connect to the bluetooth in recent years--it may need an update from the dealership. there is an aux port and 2 usb ports in the center console. the vehicle ride is comfortable and it seats 4 comfortably with a lot of trunk space.#the exterior of the vehicle has seen better days. the front left turn signal and rear brake lights need to replaced. the clear coat on the rear passenger door has worn through and the paint is fading. the front bumper clips are broken; but the front  bumper is still in place and seems to be secure. the driver side rear fender had a recent brush-up and is scratched.#smog check completed and passed on july 3rd 2017.#the vehicle is being sold as is.

MESSAGE: hello;#i am selling my 2014 ford fusion titanium hybrid. this car looks awesome and drives even better. i bought it in wisconsin towards the end of 2014 and used it as a commuter car for 2 years before i moved back home to nj where i work in the city and no longer need a car. in the three years that ive owned it; the car has been garaged for all but 6 months. ive never had a single mechanical issue with the car and the electronics (bluetooth connectivity; keyless entry; sound; etc.) work better than in my buddys mercedes benz. its still under factory warranty for bumper; powertrain; roadside assist and hybrid.#things i love about this car:#- keyless start/entry: i never touch my keys.#- winter warrior: i drove it in wisconsin for 2 years and i never had an issue; even going up hills. heated seats and remote starter are huge in the colder months.#- efficient: the car is rated 44 mpg city and 41 mpg highway. ive gotten a little less than that (37 - 41 mpg) but im shocked at how little i spend on gas!#- storage: its got way more trunk than your average hybrid and the seats fold down to allow additional storage. ive moved in this car alone.#- sound: the deluxe sony sound system will knock your socks off. the bass is deep and it gets loud. usb; bluetooth and aux plugs.#- connectivity: my phone pairs flawlessly. the touchscreen works amazingly well.#- the look: check the pictures.#park assist: never. parallel. park. again.#moonroof#other things: all records; no accidents; one owner; perfect first car#be advised: the car has a couple minor dings shown in final 2 pictures. 1) there is a scratch on the right bumper which has been touched up with ford-factory paint. 2) there is a slight dent in the passenger door.

TITLE: 2006 ford fusion. needs love to be your next hoopty (mechanics special
ATTR: condition: fair#cylinders: 4 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 161140#paint color: custom#size: mid-size#title status: clean#transmission: manual#type: sedan
MESSAGE: i have here a well loved ford fusion. the old girl has seen a lot and has been all over the country. there is a lot of character in this car. i just want to see her go to a good home; if not; she gets scrapped as i dont have the time to fix her.#now for the rundown:#the bad:#bad cam follower (push rod); this needs to be addressed pronto. the part is cheap; but i dont have the time or tools to take her apart and replace it. honestly they should all be replaced just to be sure#no front turn signals due to bad smart junction box. this problem is actually fairly common but ford doesnt think its a safety risk so they wont replace the part under a recall.#fender bender a few years ago took out the front end; this sadly includes the wiper fluid resivoir. so use a squeegee at the gas station.#lots of cosmetic damage. as i said; this car has been everywhere; including trails and shit that the car probably wasnt made for. she made it through admirably; but the paint got a bit scratched. but hey; the paint job is custom courtesy of time and hard use.#some cigarette burns. drunk friends dont help your cars interior; but they do add character to the car.#now for the good:#got a set of tires i will include; they are about 80% and are nice continentals. didnt have time to put them on before her problems started.#strong motor. besides the cam follower she hadnt lost any power or ever given me trouble. very solid motor still. with 161;140 miles she still has plenty of life left in her.#lots of trunk space.#comfy to ride in#has a cd player! talk about retro! (i kid; but lets face it; the rest of this post is pretty ridiculous so i might as well live it up)#its a 5 speed manual; clutch and tranny are still good to go. no slipping out of gear or any other bullshit.#super cheap and relatively easy to fix; just needs a bit of love.#dont let her fool you. this has been an amazing car for me for 5 years. i would love to keep her; but i have another car and dont have any time to work on her. if you are willing to replace the cam follower (push rod) you will have a solid ride once again; but it will take some elbow grease so please be serious about taking on a bit of a project. will need a tow. cash only. thanks for looking

TITLE: 2013 ford fusion titanium w/ecoboost only 26000 miles
ATTR: condition: excellent#cylinders: 4 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 25768#paint color: red#size: mid-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: with two grandbabies and a fur baby that likes to look out the window while in route; it is time for me to upgrade to a 7 passenger vehicle.  i have owned my 2013 ford fusion titanium since june of 2013 and have loved the car.  the ride and handling is exceptional; but more than anything the performance of this vehicle is outstanding!#this old lady (55) has a heavy foot and never wants to drive a vehicle that cant get out and go.  this car can go for a 6 cylinder! the turbo ecoboost engine is quiet and performs beautifully!   gas mileage is good; i am not one to check it; i fill the car with gasoline when it needs it and do a lot of local driving; thus the low mileage for its age.#a few things that i really love about the vehicle are the drivers seat is very comfortable and has all the power adjustments; including lumbar support.  the backup camera is wonderful and shows; red; yellow and green indicators; as well as turns on the screen as you turn making it very useful and not just a required accessory as in many of the new vehicles.#i also like its size and trunk space is huge in comparison to similar vehicles.  i always had enough space for whatever i wanted to carry; be it stroller; golf clubs or groceries; everything fit.#it has been regularly maintained at the local ford dealership for routine oil changes at 3;000 mile intervals and tires have been rotated as suggested.  other than the oil being changed; it has needed no repairs.#this car would be perfect for anyone looking for dependability and a smooth ride.  i took the depreciation and i am passing the savings onto you.#it wont last long as its a sharp car and its priced right.  you can see it at our business; dehaan rv center located in elkhorn; wi at 9 deere rd.  call us to make sure it is still available.  call#show contact info#during the day or#show contact info#after 5pm.
